snippet.title: At least one injured after light plane crash lands in paddock
snippet.content: Emergency crews are treating one person, believed to be a pilot, after a light plane crashed in a paddock in Melbourne's south-east. Crews were called to Pound Road in Clyde North just after 10.30am after witnesses reported seeing smoke come from the plane. A caller told 3AW it appeared as though the pilot was looking for a place to land. A spokesperson for Ambulance Victoria said a passenger appears trapped inside the aircraft but is believed to be stable. An air ambulance has been sent to the scene. This is a breaking news story. More information will be added as it comes to hand. (C) Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
